setting.name: Network ID
setting.description: The Vendor Identification Number (VID). Only radio modems with matching VIDs can communicate with each other.

setting.name: Preamble ID
setting.description: The preamble ID for which the module communicates. Only modules with matching preamble IDs can communicate with each other. Different preamble ID's minimize interference between multiple sets of modules operating in the same vicinity. When receiving a packet this is checked before the network ID, as it is encoded in the preamble, and the network ID is encoded in the MAC header.

setting.name: Retries
setting.description: The maximum number of RF packet delivery attempts. If RR is non-zero and MT is zero, packets sent from the radio will request an acknowledgement, and can be resent up to RR times if no acknowledgements are received.

setting.name: Multi-Transmit
setting.description: The number or retransmissions. If MT parameter is a non-zero value, RR is ignored and all packets are sent MT+1 times, without any delay between the transmissions.

setting.name: Delay Slots
setting.description: The maximum number of delay slots used for random back-off algorithm after transmission failure. A delay slot is 5 msec when BR=1 and 54 msec when BR=0.

setting.name: Streaming Limit
setting.description: The maximum number of continuous bytes transmitted by one module before forcing a delay that allow other modules to transmit. 0 = disabled.

setting.name: Destination Address
setting.description: The destination address. 0xFFFF is broadcast.

setting.name: Source Address
setting.description: The source address. If set to 0xFFFF, then the DT address is used for both source and destination addresses.

setting.name: Address Mask
setting.description: The address mask for configuration of local and global address spaces.

setting.name: AES Encryption Key
setting.description: The AES encryption settings. Set 256-bit key (64 hex digits) on multiple radios for encrypted RF communication. Set to '0' to disable encryption. Reading parameter returns a '0' (encryption disabled) or '1' (enabled). The key cannot be read for security reasons.

category.name: Serial Interfacing
category.description: Configure serial (UART) interface and I/O line options

setting.name: Baud Rate
setting.description: Select the serial interface rate (speed for data transfer between radio modem and host). Values from 0-8 select preset standard rates. Values at 0x4B0 and above select actual baud rate. Serial data rate does not have to match the RF data rate which is adjustable using the BR command. If the serial data rate is set higher than the RF data rate, flow control may need to be observed to prevent data in buffer overrun.

setting.name: Parity
setting.description: Select the parity setting for UART communications.

setting.name: Stop Bits
setting.description: Select the number of stop bits used for UART communications.

setting.name: Packetization Threshold
setting.description: Character packetization threshold. RF transmission is begun after receiving RB bytes, or after receiving at least 1 byte and seeing RO character times of silence on the UART.

setting.name: Packetization Timeout
setting.description: RF transmission begins after receiving RB bytes, or after receiving at least 1 byte and seeing RO character times of silence on the UART. If RO=0, then RB bytes must be received before beginning transmission.

setting.name: GPO1 Configuration
setting.description: Select the behavior of the GP01 pin, CTS on DB9).

setting.name: GPI1 Configuration
setting.description: Select the function for the GPI1 pin, RTS on DB9).

setting.name: GPO2 Configuration
setting.description: Select the behavior of the GP02 pin, DCD & DSR on DB9).

setting.name: Software Flow Control
setting.description: Select software flow control options. Enables software flow control (XON/XOFF) between radio modem and host.

setting.name: Flow Control Threshold
setting.description: Set/read the flow control threshold. De-assert CTS and/or send XOFF when FT bytes are in the UART receive buffer.

setting.name: API Enable
setting.description: Packet mode API formats frames into packets from the RF link to the serial port. It expects serial port packets to be formatted and transmits as a packet over the RF link.

category.name: RF Interfacing
category.description: Configure RF power level, RF data rate, etc.

setting.name: RF Data Rate
setting.description: Select RF data rate (over-the-air transmission rate).

setting.name: TX Power Level
setting.description: Select transmit power level. Note that certain power supply requirments must be met to maximize output power. If not met the radio will transmit at the highest power level possible and set a warning flag. See manual for more details.

setting.name: Transmit Only
setting.description: Select TX/RX or TX Only.

setting.name: Forced Sync Time
setting.description: The forced re-sync period. Normally only the first packet of a transmission event contains the sync preamble. This command allows forced periodic sync preambles during long transmission events. Zero disables this feature.

setting.name: RF Mode
setting.description: Polling base responsible for polling remotes. Polling remote needs a poll in order to transmit. Repeater resends RF data unless it is to self or it has been seen. Repeater end node handles repeated messages, but will not repeat.

setting.name: Minimum Polling Delay
setting.description: The polling delay for base node or polling timeout for remote node. Polling delay is time between polling cycles on base unit measured in milliseconds. Polling timeout is the amount of time the remote unit will hold data from the serial port before it discards it. Time measured in hundredths of seconds.

setting.name: Polling Begin Address
setting.description: The beginning address for polling base unit. Only applies for MD=3.

setting.name: Polling End Address
setting.description: The ending address for polling base unit. Only applies for MD=3.

setting.name: Maximum RF Packet Size
setting.description: The maximum RF packet size used in transparent mode. Must be 256 (0x100) or less for 9600 RF baud rate (BR=0), and 2048 (0x800) or less for 115200 RF baud rate (BR=1).

category.name: Diagnostics
category.description: Commands used for displaying modem status information

setting.name: Serial Number High
setting.description: Read high 16 bits of 32 bit unique serial number

setting.name: Serial Number Low
setting.description: Read low 16 bits of 32 bit unique serial number

setting.name: Firmware Version
setting.description: Read module firmware version number

setting.name: Hardware Version
setting.description: Read module hardware version number

setting.name: RSSI PWM Timer
setting.description: The duration of PWM (pulse width modulated) output on pin 11. The PWM output encodes fade margin (RX signal strength relative to RX sensitivity) by varying the duty cycle of a 125Hz square wave.

setting.name: Board Temperature
setting.description: Read the current temperature of module in degrees Celsius (8-bit twos-complement, eg. 26C = 0x1A, -10C = 0xF6).

setting.name: Board Voltage
setting.description: Read supply voltage to module (VCC) multiplied by 65536 (eg. 5.02V = 5.02*65536 = 0x5051F, maximum of 5 digits returned).

setting.name: Last Packet RSSI
setting.description: Read signal level of last good packet received (RSSI) in dB (reports absolute value, eg. -88dBm = 0x58, accurate between -40 dBm to RX sensitivity).

setting.name: Receive Error Count
setting.description: The number of RF Packets rejected because of bit errors in the packet.

setting.name: Good Packets Received
setting.description: The number of RF Packets successfully received.

setting.name: Transmission Failure Count
setting.description: Read the number of RF packets sent where retries expire with no ACK received (when RR>0)

category.name: Sleep
category.description: Configure module to conserve energy using Sleep Modes

setting.name: Sleep Mode
setting.description: Select Sleep Mode option. Lowest power is achieved using the SHDN signal on the module. Cyclic sleep can be used to trade idle current consumption for transmission latency.

setting.name: Time before Sleep
setting.description: The time period of inactivity (no serial or RF data is sent or received) before activating Sleep Mode - Only valid with Cyclic and Serial Port Sleep settings.

setting.name: Time before Wake-up Initializer
setting.description: Allowed range: 0-0x53E2, 0xFFFF (no wake-up initializer sent). The time of inactivity (no serial or RF data is sent or received) before a Wake-up Initializer is sent. HT should be set shorter than ST of all remote radios.

setting.name: Wake-up Initializer Timer
setting.description: Set/read time of the Wake-up Initializer used to wake remote radios that are in cyclic sleep mode. Time of Wake-up Initializer should be longer than that of the remotes radio's cyclic sleep cycle (SM 4-8).

setting.name: Pin Wake-Up
setting.description: Select pin wake-up options. When PW=1, pin wake-up from Cyclic Sleep Mode is enabled.

setting.name: Guard Time Before
setting.description: The required DI pin silent time before the Command Sequence Characters of the Command Mode Sequence (BT+CC_AT). The DI silent time is used to prevent inadvertent entrance into Command Mode.

setting.name: Command Sequence Character
setting.description: The character value used to enter command mode. The default value (0x2B) is the ASCII code for the plus ('+') character. It must be entered three times within the guard times (BT and AT) to enter command mode.

setting.name: Guard Time After
setting.description: The required DI pin silent time after the Command Sequence Characters of the AT Command Mode Sequence (BT+CC+AT). The DI silent time is used to prevent inadvertent entrance into Command Mode.

setting.name: Command Mode Timeout
setting.description: The command mode timeout parameter. If no valid commands have been received within this time period, module returns to Idle Mode from AT Command Mode.
